reviewText: On days that I just want to have a good time playing the guitar without getting to technical these cd's come to mind. John makes even the simple metal lessons fun and if you follow him you will improve. THAT'S WHAT COUNTS.

I'm still in the beginning stages of going through this set of DVDs but that's due more to time constraints than anything else. I've been playing for years but decided to get these because I felt my playing and techniques were stagnant. While I haven't gone through much of the course what I have gone through I can say is really good. I have actually really expanded my use of the whole fretboard in the little time I've had to work with this. All in all I would recommend it, not for a very advanced player, but if you're new to metal or a beginner I think you would be hard pressed to not find something useful in the course.
The dvds contain a lot of info. McCarthy teaches at a good pace, and shows both right and left hand when needed. Website access also cool.
he is a good teacher  ,i've bought  many dvd tutorials  and this one  is very good ,i have finish disc one , i still has to go through the other two, but i have good vibes
From basic to advanced...Everyone can gain something from this set to enhance their abilities playing and getting better. Highly recommended. Sc
One of the best dvd lessons ive ever seen. The instructor was very knowlegable. Everything was easy to understand. The online help is great. I would recommend this lesson to everyone.

I've got about 5 months of lessons on acoustic guitar doing basic chords, scales, 3 chord songs, etc. It was fun but I want to rock! This DVD set has been awesome...I'm working my new electric guitar over on the first disc, over and over again... it's clear, concise, and makes you feel like you're actually playing. Scales become possibilities for lead guitar riffs instead of boring practice. The ability to play with backup drums/bass is awesome for timing and precision. I'll buy the Rock version soon because this stuff is working. Practice makes perfect but practicing with tools like these makes real progress possible... which makes practice something you want to do!!

FINALLY a DVD guitar instructional that makes sense! I was so impressed with this set I also bought the 3-disc set for Rock guitar as well. John is a top notch instructor. The video shows plenty of close up shots and slows down enough so that you can see what he is doing. Tab is also included through the DVD. You must print it yourself. (Roughly 35-40 pages) My guitar playing has sky rocketed since practicing with these videos one hour a day. Like anything, you MUST practice to get better. I will now only buy Rock Guitar Method Videos. Thanks John Mccarthy for your help in teaching the art of shred and Metal guitar. Keep Rockin'
Helped out so much with my guitar playing, easy to follow instructions.
This DVD series is amazing! If you really want to learn to play the guitar but don't know where to begin, this series is for you. It is so easy to learn from John's method.
thank you very much!

Ive taught myself guitar and ive been playing for three years now and this dvd set is the best teaching ive had! It taught more than what i knew and it gets better and better with each lesson improving everything ive learned!

This is an awesome mega pack!! No need to waste money on guitar lessons while owning this. If you buy this mega pack then don't buy the Lead Guitar DVD featuring John McCarthy because the third disc of this mega pack is the same as the lead guitar DVD.
I do like the series of the three DVDs. A few things are repeated from intermediate to advanced but it's a good value for newer players.
Will get you some basic playing ability with ease.

Good way to learn. I used it and it helped me lots. There is also so website help and PDF files to save so you can learn chords with out the vid. Both work will together. Easy to learn at your own pace. Recommended buy.

I really like this product and will be buy more from Rock House Method. The lessons are clear,  easy to understand and have a great pace to them. The extra things that come with it like the free membership to the online community and the site is also pretty good.

Viewed as expected, but it does appear to be old (1997 maybe)

I thought out of the 3 cds, there were maybe 2 or 3 things useful to the advanced guitarist. Other than that, this should be a newbie training system. Dude, John was killing me with that awful sounding telecaster on disc 1.

This is a really good beginner's set. The first couple of discs take you by the hand and walk you through the instruction as if you've never held a guitar in your entire life. By the third disc, he starts giving you some really decent exercises, though.

Knocked one star off for video quality. Looks like it may have been converted from VHS or something, I don't know. It's not so terrible that you can't work with it; however, it is noticeable. I wouldn't let that stop you from getting this set if you are looking for something that will help you start playing the guitar. Even if you aren't a total beginner, some of the stuff on the third disc is still useful.

All-in-all, two thumbs up. This resource can help you if you are willing to put in the time to practice every day.
